newsitem.title: POLAND: LDA plans new issues of shares, bonds.
newsitem.headline: LDA plans new issues of shares, bonds.

text.p: Polish printing company Ludzka Drukarnia Akcydensowa SA (LDA) is to increase its capital through two new share issues and convertible bonds, the firm said on Thursday.

It said in a statement that part of the first issue, series C, would be one-to-one rights. The second part, consisting of registered shares, would be directed to strategic investors other than the firm's current shareholders and would not be traded on the bourse.
LDA's planned convertible bonds issue would be exchangable for the second share issue, series D, the statement said.
No further details were immediately available.
LDA's capital is divided into 1,383,440 shares, of which 1,083,440 are approved for public trade on the parallel market.
LDA netted 810,000 zlotys last year on revenues of 30 million zlotys.
